intro: Campylocentrum peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian star apple, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant produces a fruit with a sweet, white, star-shaped pulp that is often eaten raw. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated in various tropical regions around the world.
